oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Moon is not to be laughed at. By /han kass o (L VIII
8443, 8446). People say that the Moon becomes angry when they laugh at it. People thus call it | kuan ttu to show it respect to try and keep it from going into the sky. The Moon's wife is ||ko'on.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Moon not to be laughed at
